title_sort: richard j. hinton to walt whitman, 12 december 1875
title: Richard J. Hinton to Walt Whitman, 12 December 1875
text: Washington D.C.Dec 12thMy Dear Walt Whitman:When you were here I was closely confined to the desk, and did not find out till you were gone where you stopped. I was & am very sorry I have missed you. Shortly I expect to be in PhilaPhiladelphiaâ€”when I shall come over to Camden and find you.I am very glad to learn that you are as well as you are, & that inspirationstill dwells with you. Conway's letter speaking of your new book is quite interesting. Will you let me know about if I can say something in adorance of its appearance. My brain will always do you homage & my heart will bring love to you.Mrs H deserves rememberance. I have a book out, which I will send to-morrow. Yours AlwaysAffectionatelyRichard J. HintonAddress me Care "The Republic" W_D.C. Richard J. Hinton to Walt Whitman, 12 December 1875
